place.name: YARDLEY HASTINGS
place.gazetteerText: YARDLEY-HASTINGS, a parish, with a village, in Hardingstone district, Northamptonshire; 3¼ miles S of Castle-Ashby r. station, and 8 ESE of Northampton. It has a post-office under Northampton, and a fair on Whit-Monday. Acres, 3,510. Real property, £3,323. Pop., 1,152. Houses, 256. The manor belongs to the Marquis of Northampton. The living is a rectory, united with part of Denton, in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £400.* Patron, the Marquis of Northampton. The church is partly Norman, partly early English. There are an Independent chapel and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
